args:
A band of brigands suddenly appears with a
Qilin relic. The party has trouble dealing with
the relic—known as the Hong Hulu—but thanks
to Xuan Zang and her group, the thugs are
driven off, and the journey resumed.
...So then I had me a little brainstorm:\nIf I used the chuckleberry, something\nhilarious was BOUND to happen!
Ha ha ha! You are a prank ANIMAL, Luca!\nSo what happened after that?
Ha ha! The next thing to happen was...
Well, them two are gettin' thick as thieves.
If we continue to let them bounce ideas\noff each other, we are all likely to awaken\nwith itching powder in our smallclothes.
*wheeze* *pant* How do they have...\nthe energy for idle chatter...?
You're looking a little rough there, Cleo.\nAre you feeling okay?
I will manage... Er, but do we have\nmuch further to go yet?
We've a few mountains yet to cross.\nAlso, I fear we're on something of a\ndetour at present.
I sensed the presence of a Qilin relic\nin this vicinity.
As a sealer, I cannot turn a blind eye\nto any such possible activity.
Can we at least take a short rest here?
Of course. There is little sense in\npushing ourselves to the brink.
Still, I AM a little worried to hear there\nmight be a Qilin relic nearby.

Remember that while we use ＂Qilin relic＂
as a blanket term, it includes average,
workaday items as well as terrible ones.
You need not be quite so on your guard.
Wait, for seriously?! The way you guys\nwere talking, I figured all Qilin relics\nwere giant death doohickeys or whatever.
Perhaps I should explain myself further.\nA Qilin relic is the term for ANY tool\nused by the ancient Qilin people.

If you cast your gaze back into antiquity,
you will find the Qilin bathed in glory.
The fantastic technology and magic at their
disposal shaped the entire world itself.
Some of these devices are far beyond\nthe ken of even the most intelligent\nmodern Qilin.
That's quite the claim, given what\nwe know of the modern tribe.
Quite so. However, while many of these\nobjects were fantastical, far more were\nof the basic, day-to-day variety.
There were pots that produced water,\nplates that kept food warm, and so on.
Ah, but I have only begun to regale you\nwith tales of Qilin relics! For example...
Ugh. I'm too old to be goin' back to school.
I had no idea these relics were so... Hmm?
He's probably out looking for a legendary\nsandwich tree or some other food-related\nnonsense.
Normally I wouldn't be worried, but now\nthat we have Qilin relics in the mix,\nI'm a little concerned.
Welp, guess we should go find the big\nlug and track him down, yeah? ...Also,\nIS there a legendary sandwich tree?
Goodness, but he is a handful.
...No dice! The guy up and vanished like\na fart in the wind. ...Uh, and why are\nyou two giving me those weird looks?
Because you're the only member of\nthe search party who came back.
This cannot be mere coincidence.\nIt is likely the doing of someone who\nhas obtained the nearby Qilin relic.
Yo, Yulong! That nose of yours broken or\nsomething?! Get to sniffing out that relic!
I will not have you treat me\nas some base hound!
I guess our only option is to keep looking.
I'm from the nearby village. I was out\ngathering herbs when I twisted my ankle.
Well then, let us help you get home.
You're much too kind, thank you.\nOh, but I fear I have no way to\npossibly repay you.
There's no payment necessary.\nHere, can you stand?
I think so... Oh, wait! I DO have something\nto repay you with! Please take this.
Er, is this a gourd with water inside?
Not water, but a specialized medicine.\nOne sip will wash away all of your fatigue.\nIt's quite the popular item in my village!
Well, I suppose a sip won't hurt...
Hee hee... AAAH HA HA HA!
You've been deceived, you dolt!\nWhoever uncorks this gourd\nwill be sucked up into it!
Now get into that bottle, just like\nyour friends!
AAAAAAH HA HA HA HA HA!
BWAAAA HA HA HA... Um, ha?\nHey, wait! Why aren't you being\nswallowed up by the gourd thingie?!
Because I weakened the power\nof this Qilin relic.
Okay, who are you, and what did\nyou do to my evil gourd?!
We just baited you like a fish hook, fool!
We knew someone was up to no good\nwith the Qilin relic around here, but I\nnever expected it to be so petty.
You are naught but a mean brigand who\nhas been using the relic to attack travelers\nand steal their money and possessions.
As both a member of the Qilin tribe and\na sealer, I cannot abide those who would\nmisuse our relics.
I'm not following any of this, and I don't\nreally care if I ever do. ...C'mere, boys!\nWe've got some butts to kick!
That's it? We're fighting now? Boooo-ring.\nOh, hey, I thought of something good!\nLemme see that, {player_name}!
Yep! Now it's my time to shine...\nO power universal, heed my solemn\ndecree! Behold the coffin of eternity!
Easy-peasy, right? Oh, but wait.\nThere's more. Aaaand...POP!
GYAAAAR... Huh? Hey, wait a sec.\nDidn't that gourd thingie just swallow me?
And out! In! Out! In! Out!\nWaaaah ha ha ha ha!\nOh man, I SLAY me!
Sure thing, master. But you gotta admit,\nit WAS pretty funny.
Well, THAT was embarrassin'.\nCan't believe I got hoodwinked\nby such a lame trick.
Gotta admit, I didn't expect to spend much\ntime inside a gourd when I woke up today.

That ＂gourd＂ you refer to is the Hong
Hulu—a frightfully powerful Qilin
relic in the form of a harmless fruit.
You could not have known otherwise.
In any case, I'm glad everyone is safe.\nThank you, Xuan Zang.
And you as well, Wu Kong. You have\nquite the command of those Qilin relics.
Please spare him your compliments.\nThey go right to his head.
Ugh! You always shut me down right\nwhen I'm about to have some fun.
Well, now that we have dealt with that\nunanticipated difficulty, perhaps we\ncan set off for the village?
From the sound of it, we're still a ways off,\nso we'd better get moving.
